caption: It was a difficult choice, but I think I made the right one.  It was so good I'll need to go back and confirm.  Intimate setting and attentive, efficient staff know their daily specials and are quite enthusiastic about them.  Unfortunately I could only choose one, so I can tell you that try homemade fettuccine with salmon is a hit.  My dining partner swears by the lasagne.    We are both sure that there are no bad choices to be made on this menu.  The restaurant serves wine, but does not offer beer of any kind.
Possibly the best thin sliced pizza I have ever had. The service was super quick and efficient and it felt genuinely Italian. Loved the salad as well. The backyard was pretty cute as well
Tasty. Great service. Great safe seating.  Just what I needed!
Delicious food. Every dish we took was heavenly. Great service! You have to go
Uber eats and restaurant have awesome collaborations
Love this place - the staff are always super friendly, they've a great backyard. Particular fan of their linguine vongole and charred octopus starter

We came here today for the first time, it was absolutely amazing! I can’t wait to come back. I had to order a second pizza to take home, it was exactly the way I like it.  The pasta was extremely satisfying, you tasted the ingredients which were fresh and delicious. I prefer food like here, in which you can taste the quality of the ingredients, simple and delicious, rather than stuffed with grease and can’t taste anything.  Everyone was very kind and welcoming. Everything was 10/10. We are going to come back to try more...
The food is AMAZING!! Love ordering in from here!! Fast delivery too.

WE LOVE THIS PLACE. We go here for dates. We go here for takeout. We go here for dinner parties. The staff is incredibly accommodating. My partner and I both have allergies and restrictions when it comes to eating and they are completely kind about it. They never make us feel as annoying as it probably is to accommodate our restrictions. The food is amazing and I Connor recommend this place enough. Great price point, authentic cuisine, beautiful outdoor space, and enclosed patio in the front (since covid) please check this place out! -ASH
One of the best pizzas I've had in BK!
Food was awesome. Loved the ambiance. Our waiter was awesome. Prices fair. Dessert perfect.
Very delicious food and very friendly atmosphere. A little bit of Italy!!! Perfect!!!
great little place with wonderful atmosphere, delicious italian food and lovely owners

I went here on a Tuesday night, friendly staff, good wine, I got the truffle mushroom pizza and it was excellent. I sat outside in the front but I believe they also have garden seating, so ample outdoor tables

I'm writing this review in regards to an Uber eats order i placed on behalf of myself and P. Conley last night on her Uber eats account. I ordered the Emilia Pie , around 8 pm. wait time was 50 minutes which is ok. After waiting an hour, our delivery driver was still waiting for our pizza, and had to wait an additional 10 minutes at the restaurant til it was ready.  fast forward getting our ONE PIE, an hour and a half later (over 30 minutes LATE): The pie was absolutely ICE cold, the toppings on the box more than the pie, and it was extremely soggy, to the point the parts of the slices towards the center of the pie had to be scraped off the bottom of the box because it wasnt fully cooked ,yet the outer crust was done well.  I've had their Emilia pizza before and it was great IN THE PAST. What we got last night was disguising to the point we threw it away because the dough wasn't cooked.  I am reasonable and can understand some things are out of your control at the restaurant like the pie getting cold en route. i wouldn't even care about that because i always reheat any pizza i get delivered, or even the topping sliding around because that could be the delivery persons fault, BUT THE DOUGH IN THE MIDDLE OF THE PIE WAS RAW, SOGGY AND INEDIBLE.  You sent the pie out like that, after it not being ready after an hour. i would have rather waited longer if that meant i received food that was edible. No, i dont want to wait an hour and a half for a pie on a TUESDAY night (its not friday or saturday), but a pizzeria that sends out food like that  to their customers when its already late to a customer is adding insult to injury and honestly shows poor customer service  I'm really disappointed . so after almost 2 hours, I was still hungry, and wasted my money. On top of that, because i placed my order on Uber Eats, I couldn't even get my money back on the order.  I don't normally write a place off after one bad experience, but this one was so bad that we will.  Sad to say I  will never order from here again, and don't recommend anyone to for delivery.
we love baciccia- delicious food, great atmosphere and lovely staff
So cozy. Great pies.
(Translated by Google) very good!  (Original) bravissimo!
I came upon this gem thanks to Chef Agiv Al Aviv from Passatempo, he treated us to an unbelievable dinner with his friends from Liguria. Thanks to everyone at Baciccia for this great experience!!!
Great food
A perfect little gem!

I’ve lived in Brooklyn for a long time and I make it a point to try all the well known pizza places - Spumoni, Di Fara, etc. and this is seriously one of the best pizzas I have EVER had whilst living in NY! I LOVE this place - the staff is so nice. It’s an amazing hidden gem.
Great local Italian place. Very friendly and helpful staff!

(Translated by Google) Never been, but a friend's restaurant in Brooklyn that makes delicious and artisanal cuisine  (Original) Mai stata, ma ristorante a Brooklyn di un amico che fa cucina buonissima e artigianale

I absolutly love everything about Baccicia. The service was amazing and the employees were super nice. The food there is also amazing and comes straight from the oven! I 100% recommend if you are looking for some classic Italian food.
Love this place!
A cozy place, excellent service.  At all times we were treated very well and the food exquisite.  Try the dessert "Torta de la Nonna" is perfect. Beautiful place.

We had a perfect evening! Warm and super friendly service, a delicious bottle of wine for < 40.00 (Umbrian Cabernet) pasta perfectly cooked, well grilled pork chop and lamb chops and amazing deserts, panacotta and tiramisu were light and shareable. Can’t wait to return.
Baciccia salad with chicken was delicious but small for a 19 dollar salad, mozzarella pizza was very good not as heavy as other run of the mill pizza.

Great and cozy place. We ordered pizza and lasagna, which was delicious especially pizza-maybe the best in the area, special price on beers. Also very friendly and professional staff, kids friendly. Definitely would visit again.

I had to find a place last minute to accommodate a small wedding dinner for 15 people. Sandro and Giorgio were so welcoming so attentive and served us as if they were a 5 star catering service. They didnt have to but did!!!. I must mention the food.... Really good high quality Italian. The bread and all pizza crust was mouth watering... So tasty. Thank you!!
Best food around. Italians straight from Italy making homemade breads(best bread I ever had in my life.), pizzas, lamb and other mouth watering food. Desert is a homerun also.
Excellent good price
So delicious. Exactly what we were looking for. The staff are all so very friendly as well. I can't wait to go back to this restaurant
I had an extraordinary  at this place. We enjoyed the awesome environment and the menu. The waiters were very amiable. I am glad we ultimately decided to try this restaurant.

2/18/2019 Food is really good in this place , Giorgio , one of the Owner is always very very nice ! When they get the wine license this place is gonna be incredible ! They have also a great garden too !

Can't say enough about how friendly they are here. So welcoming and a delight to be around. Seating is a bit more spacious than you'd normally find around town and there's even outdoor space out back that you wouldn't know at first glance when you first walk in. Keep that in mind, if you'd like some outdoor eating!  Delicious food and cocktails. The burrata is very tasty here and went well in their appetizer and pasta. Only knock was the chicken dish as it surprisingly lacked flavor, but an otherwise tasty time
(Translated by Google) ISSA VERY GOOD !!!  (Original) ISSA MOLTO BENE!!!
Happened upon this little gem by accident. What a treasure! I will definitely be back. Great prices and wonderful friendly staff.
Friendly atmosphere, good service, good food
(Translated by Google) Very tasty pizza and very nice people.  (Original) Muy rica pizza y gente muuuy amable.
Sangio pizza was amazing! Make sure to add the chili oil for spice.

(Translated by Google) My boyfriend and I went to dinner at Baciccia last Sunday. We had the pleasure of meeting Sandro, a fantastic and friendly person at the same time. He made us feel at home making us eat excellent dishes. STRACONSIGLIAMO !!!  (Original) Io e il mio fidanzato siamo stati a cena da Baciccia la scorsa domenica. Abbiamo avuto il piacere di conoscere Sandro, persona  fantastica e cordiale allo stesso tempo. Ci ha fatto sentire a casa facendoci mangiare degli ottimi piatti. STRACONSIGLIAMO!!!
Absolutely lovely place to eat! Very friendly people! The food is great! And also try the tiramisu! Its amazing. Its tiramisu How its suppose to be!!
Best Margarita pizza I had in my life.  Not kidding.  I ate the whole 8 slice pizza.  Was a first in my life

This place is quaint and nice. We were here on the weekend. Ordered the Nostrana pizza with pancetta and salad. The portions are huge, so two of us shared this followed by coffee. For dessert we ordered the coconut sorbet at the chef's recommendation. The late afternoon is not so crowded. So we had a good time. The garden was open but we chose to eat inside with a view of the road. The service is fantastic, the food is delicious, fresh and cheap. The pizza is light, airy and fantastic!

Excellent service in a cute neighborhood Italian place. Ossobuco was superb. I thought the bolognese was a bit bland but the wine list was interesting and fairly priced. Generous portions and friendly, knowledgeable servers.

IT’S EASY at this Italian eatery in Park Slope to know why Italians eat Italian food three times everyday: the cuisine is simple and delicious and satisfying. A narrow venue with bare-brick walls, four tops mainly, and a garden, Baciccia has  salads and mains as delicious in the Italian manner as it’s pizzas. The owners are charming and attentive and give good advice on food and beverages, such as a delicious Primitivo wine from southern Italy that was entirely delicious and a bargain. Kids, solo diners and groups were all in place on a Friday. LOO REVIEW: A unisex facility, the toilet is not for the claustrophobic. Six feet long, with throne and sink facing each other, the space is not much wider than a coffin. Think airline toilet times two. Clean and properly supplied.

What a fantastic little restaurant! My wife had the mista and I had lasagna. The chef did superbly and the atmosphere is perfectly cozy. Also, the orders come fast! We ordered a margherita pizza to go as we were finishing our entrees and it was on our table before we were done. We're coming back later this week, that's for sure. UPDATE: we ended up going four days in a row. The prices are fantastic for such beautifully crafted meals; this was the best food deal in Brooklyn. We can't wait to come back later this year.

Great interior decor but mediocre pizza spot. Nothing wrong with the pizza but just not that noteworthy. Service was okay. Environment is fine too. Overall baciccia is good, the food has really great ingredients - but for the price i left hungry. 3/5, would go back for sure. But the spicy olive oil is really great, definitely get that
Excellent place! Delicious pizza and pasta! Service is fast and very attentive. Everyone is super nice. Good quality Coffee and always fresh Italian deserts! Coming back soon!
Very good Italian food, great service, affordable price. You can bring wine with you or buy in a shop next to it with 10% discount.  I like this place.  Highly recommended.
Excellent regional taste galore...
Excellent Italian food, with a wide range of dishes. The servers are helpful and prompt, and the posters on the wall are really a nice touch to the atmosphere.
Great food.
Good food Lovely neighborhood place A real treasure

Authentic Italian; go for the pizza first though, if only because it's so well done. Quick service, and never too much of a wait for a table. BYOB, so grab some wine from the liquor store down the block and enjoy a reasonably priced date night. Definitely recommend!

Delicious dough with just the right amount of chewiness. The pizza at Baciccia is great! I'm deducting a star because the pasta in the lasagna was still raw. It was hard to tell whether the pasta in the lasagna was raw or it was that texture because it's fresh pasta. I ended up taking half of 3/4 of it home so I could reheat/cook it in the microwave the next day. TIP: Baciccia is BYOB (bonus!). Slope Cellars is next door and I believe they give a discount if you tell them you are getting a bottle for dinner at Baciccia.
(Translated by Google) Delicious pizza and pesto and desserts above all !! Highly recommended !!  (Original) Buonissimo la pizza e il pesto e i dolci soprattutto!! Consigliatissimo!!

Great service, a charming homey place and delicious food! We've ordered the polenta with gorgonzola and mushrooms as an appetizer - it came a bit different from what we are used to - the cheese was crumbled instead of a sauce, and the polenta was thick and a bit crispy on the  outside. My husband loved the combination of mushrooms on top. I ordered the pasta al pesto - it was delicious, very flavorful and my husband  got the breaded chicken - thin sliced with a crispy layer, also delicious. This restaurant is BYOB, something not very common in Park Slope. Great dinner after all, and they also let us accommodate our newborn that came in a stroller. We are definitely going back to taste the other dishes in the menu!
(Translated by Google) Very good!!  (Original) Buonissimo!!
Seriously good noms with exception service, all at a very reasonable price
Amazing pizza. Friendly staff
Very good food
Came here for my husband birthday. Everything we had was delicious! Definitely a place I would recommend!

Delicious pizza and friendly staff. I think it might be the best pizza in park slope/south slope/greenwood. I think the other contender is Giuseppina's but the pizza here is really excellent. Thin crust and nice toppings with a really excellent tomato sauce

This is what a family birthday dinner should be! Ok, so it did start out a little bit bumpy... Our table wasn't ready, then decided to wait an extra 10 minutes for a table outside. But, it was sure worth the wait!! Once we settled in, we opened up our wine (BYOB, which is phenomenal in my opinion) and it felt like we had the whole backyard to ourselves. They more than made up for the earlier inconvenience with fantastic service and good food. We were able to eat, drink, catch up and have the best time. Thank you guys!!
Very nice experience! Wonderful attention from Sandro and Georgio. BYOB not a problem, three doors down from restaurant, wine shop gave us 10 % off. Food very good.
Food is outstanding, service attentive, professional, and crisp.  Eggplant appetizer is phenomenal . New favorite.
Great Pizza BYOB liquor store next to it offers 10% off if you tell them you are coming to the restaurant
Excellent food and friendly service

Great spot for actually al dente pasta.  Nice people, too.  Eat all the desserts.  At this point, it is still BYOB which is awesome because money.      Also, the name of the place is a literary refernce and who does not like that sort of nerdy cool?  Just go already.

I lived in central Italy (Gaeta) for three years and I just happened in to grab what I thought would be a slice of pizza, once seated I was pleasantly surprised to find a menu that mirrored the ones in my old town. One friend and I had the Spaghetti alla Vongole and another had the meat special which was a new York strip with figs and fingerling potatoes. Every bite was phenomenal and reminded me of nights spent dining on a patio against the Mediterranean. The wait staff was friendly and extremely accommodating (they even comped me a cafè that I embarrassingly ordered after the check came). I highly recommend and am already planning my next trip.
Amazing drinks and food

Excellent, excellent food. Great atmosphere (we ate in the garden) BYOB - the nearby wine shop give a discount for diners. I used the opportunity to splurge and bought a bottle in the "restaurant price" range, but because it was from a store it was far, far better than we'd have gotten *from* a restaurant.
Amazing place. Most delicious pizza in Park Slope. Truly Italian.
Great food and the customer service was very attentive . Highly recommended to everyone. Plus BYOB and nice patio!
(Translated by Google) Excellent  (Original) Eccellente
Charming place with good pizza and nice staff
Real Italian pizza!!!
Like being in Italy, the real deal!
Great food, nice people.

What a welcome addition to the neighborhood! Delicious food, friendly staff, Alessandro was so excited about the food he served and made sure the kids had a memorable time too. Can't wait to go back! Great food, Atmosphere, and I like having a BYOB since Slope Sellers us close and the top spot to buy wine anyway. Can't wait to go back!!
True Italian cuisine with genuine Italian ingredients. Baciccia recall my childhood vacation in Finale Ligure, Liguria, with a lot of  the best recipes of Northern Italian tradition
Excellent Italian restaurant. Very nice staff and well cooked food. 5 stars all the way.
Excellent place for good food and kid friendly
Yummy. And Byob for now, so pretty reasonable
Fantastic pizza, pasta, and atmosphere
Best pizza in Park slope. Authentic Italian experience. Coffee and deserts were amazing too.
Intimate space with simple, well-executed food.
Greeeat delicious food)
The pizza was very watery

This place was BYOB when we visited and we were told of a discount at nearby Slope Cellars. The pizza was excellent and might become my new go to for take out.  Appetizers and pasta were good. One dish we ordered never appeared, but we were not charged.
Good pizza, good service!
Great place to eat with Italian friends, like at home...
Great experience, kindness, good food, good ambience! Flavor of home!! ❤️
Nice place, amazing ORIGINAL Italian food and taste!
The food is fabulous and I can't wait to visit again.

I'm from Italy, moved here 16 years ago. I have very few Italian restaurants I love in NY and this is one of them. A gem for flavors and authenticity. I'm taking my Italian family who's visiting for the holidays. my favorite thing is the eggplant tortino YUM! my daughter loves their pizza and listen, this is really what Italian pizza tastes like back in Italy. Go now!

My family loves this new Italian place, it is very authentic, everyone there speaks Italian and everything tastes exactly like it tastes in Italy when I visit. They are kid friendly and very nice. I met the owner and he was very sweet to my daughter. We are regulars now :-)

Authentic unpretentious Italian food that reminded me of my time in Rome. Both the pizzas and pastas are fantastic. The staff is very friendly as well. Will be making this one of my regular dinner spots.
Tasty food. Meat was a little bit burnt That was a pity
Great italian food i felt at home
Excellent food and service.
4 thumbs way up. Everything is top notch. Pizza is pristine. Pasta is impeccable. Walnut sauce, whoahhhhh.

I went with a large group of friends and went for the pasta. From what I ordered and what I stole off of my friends plates the food was good and the service from the crew was attentive even as the night progressed. I'll have to try the pizza next time

I ordered pizza from Grubhub and we didn’t have a chance to even try it because after hour and a half the delivery man brought me the coldest pizza ever. Waist of money and time. Kids hungry, the family evening destroyed. 😑
Delicious food, excellent service!  Great new spot in South Slope.
Great little place. Pizza is delicious!
